text: Maria Vladimirova Penkova (, born 25 June 1984) is a retired professional tennis player from Bulgaria. ==Career== Penkova is a former member of the Bulgaria Fed Cup team. In 2005, Penkova won a European club championship in Rennes, France as a member of the Cherno More Elite team (Bulgarian: Черно море Елит). Her teammates were Virginiya Trifonova, Sesil Karatantcheva and Tsvetana Pironkova. ==ITF Circuit finals: 5 (2–3)== ===Singles: 4 (2–2)=== {|class=wikitable style="font-size:85%; width:15%;" !Legend |- style="background:#f88379;" | $100,000 tournaments |- style="background:#f7e98e;" | $75,000 tournaments |- style="background:#addfad;" | $50,000 tournaments |- style="background:lightblue;" | $25,000 tournaments |- style="background:#ccccff;" | $15,000 tournaments |- style="background:#f0f8ff;" | $10,000 tournaments |} {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%;" width="820" |- !Outcome !No. !Date !Tournament !Surface !Opponent !Score |- bgcolor="#f0f8ff" | bgcolor="FFA07A"|Runner-up | 1. | 20 March 2005 | Rome - Borghesiana, Italy | Clay | Aravane Rezai | 2–6, 3–6 |- bgcolor="#f0f8ff" | bgcolor="FFA07A"|Runner-up | 2. | 4 September 2005 | Bucharest, Romania | Clay | Corina-Claudia Corduneanu | 2–6, 3–6 |- bgcolor="#f0f8ff" | bgcolor="98FB98"|Winner | 1. | 4 June 2006 | Rousse, Bulgaria | Clay | Dia Evtimova | 5–7, 6–4, 6–1 |- bgcolor="#f0f8ff" | bgcolor="98FB98"|Winner | 2. | 9 July 2006 | Prokuplje, Serbia & Montenegro | Clay | Milijana Adanko | 6–4, 4–6, 6–4 |} ===Doubles: 1 (0–1)=== {|class=wikitable style="font-size:85%;
